snippet: I will accept her as black like me only when society can accept me as white like her.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Tamara Winfrey Harris examines case of Rachel A Dolezal, former head of the Spokane, Wash, NAACP who misrepresented herself for years as a black woman; argues Dolezal's empathy for the black cause transformed into impersonation, and that her blackness is flawed because she chose it, whereas actual black Americans are never offered such a choice; examines concept of blackness in American history, and its roots in the 'one drop' doctrine.
lead_paragraph: I will accept her as black like me only when society can accept me as white like her.

headline.main: Black Like Who? Rachel Dolezal’s Harmful Masquerade

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
